title: Fun with Addition and Subtraction
description: In this lesson, students will learn how to solve basic addition and subtraction problems using objects and drawings. They will explain their thinking and understand how to find the answers.

prompts.input: If you have 3 apples and you add 2 more apples, how many apples do you have now? Explain how you got your answer.
hints: Think about how you can count the apples you started with and the ones you added.
You can use your fingers or draw a picture to help you see the total.

prompts.input: You have 5 cookies, and you eat 1 cookie. How many cookies are left? Explain how you figured that out.
hints: Try to think about what happens to the total when you take one away.
You can draw the cookies or use your fingers to help you count how many are left.
